nodes.title: Talk to Regine; each time you do the quest, she gives you 3 Hatchets and requests that you log 3 Pla
nodes.description: Talk to Regine; each time you do the quest, she gives you 3 Hatchets and requests that you log 3 Plateau Chestnuts from the trees in Abyssea - La Theine. There is a chance the hatchets provided will break. Bring 1 or 2 more to be safe. Caution: There are few logging points up at any given time, so be ready to do a lot of running around. Movement speed gear is very useful.

nodes.title: The most common place to find Logging Points is around (I/J-11) (conflux 05); beware as it can be su
nodes.description: The most common place to find Logging Points is around (I/J-11) (conflux 05); beware as it can be surrounded by Crepuscule Puks.

nodes.title: Another place to find logging points is around D/E-5/6 close to the base camp.
nodes.description: Another place to find logging points is around D/E-5/6 close to the base camp.

nodes.title: Random logging points at L-7 (conflux 07).
nodes.description: Random logging points at L-7 (conflux 07). Head east from conflux 07 between the 2 gorges and take the ramp up that is in the south-center of (J-6).

nodes.title: Random logging points at D-8/10 around and south of tigers (conflux 02).
nodes.description: Random logging points at D-8/10 around and south of tigers (conflux 02).

nodes.title: Turn in the 3 Plateau Chestnuts to Rugiette located at the (H-7) central encampment (conflux 4).
nodes.description: Turn in the 3 Plateau Chestnuts to Rugiette located at the (H-7) central encampment (conflux 4).

nodes.description: This quest is flagged automatically after completing Tenuous Existence.

nodes.description: After completing a total of seven (7) Abyssea Main Quests, return to Port Jeuno (H-8) and talk to Joachim to trigger a cutscene. This will complete this quest and automatically flag the next.

nodes.description: Talk to Moreno-Toeno (A) who requests 3 Manigordo Tusks. Defeat Manigordos near conflux #7 (part of Dominion Op 05 (Altepa)) to obtain their tusks. They can also be purchased from the auction house.

nodes.title: Trade him the Manigordo Tusks for your reward.
nodes.description: Trade him the Manigordo Tusks for your reward. Zoning is not required to repeat.

nodes.description: Talk to Kupipi (A) at the Central Encampment at H-12. ("Refuel and Replenish" quest must be finished.)

nodes.title: Trade her 3 Sanguinets.
nodes.description: Trade her 3 Sanguinets. Sanguinets are dropped by Limules, Murex, Amoebans, and Clionidae. They can also be purchased from the Auction House under Others>Misc.

nodes.title: Go to Mathurin's Camp (G-7) and talk to Jonette (near Conflux #3), who asks you to find her cookbook
nodes.description: Go to Mathurin's Camp (G-7) and talk to Jonette (near Conflux #3), who asks you to find her cookbook.

nodes.title: You must find and click on a specific ??? to receive the Torn recipe page.
nodes.description: You must find and click on a specific ??? to receive the Torn recipe page. There are 4 places where the ??? can spawn, which cycle about every ten minutes in the following order: 1. Spiders (Due west of Conflux #00). Care must be given not to aggro the NM spider Athamas T(H). 2. Colibri (G/H-8/9 - at the base of the tree) (Closest Conflux #00 west past spiders or #04 and north past Frigatebirds). Colibri camp is completely safe. 3. Peiste (J-11) (East of Conflux #07 at the beginning of the Peiste area; not the ??? nearest the cliff wall, which spawns Sobek). Peiste aggro sight and a true-sight NM named Gukumatz can spawn. 4. Bugard (K-11) (Just north of the passageway from Conflux #08). Bugards aggro sound. Once the pattern is discovered, a fast run can be done in 2-3 minutes, average 4-5 minutes, and long runs are 6-7 minutes.

nodes.title: Return to Jonette for your reward and possibly a: Ferine Seal: Legs BST Orison Seal: Legs WHM Raider
nodes.description: Return to Jonette for your reward and possibly a: Ferine Seal: Legs BST Orison Seal: Legs WHM Raider's Seal: Legs THF Unkai Seal: Legs SAM Please update the "reward rates" for each item in the reward box above, whether you get a seal or not.

nodes.title: Talk to the Resistance Sapper and you will receive a paralysis trap fluid.
nodes.description: Talk to the Resistance Sapper and you will receive a paralysis trap fluid.

nodes.title: There are Three Rear Traps: South Trap: Closest rear trap, a 30 sec walk south west of resistance sa
nodes.description: There are Three Rear Traps: South Trap: Closest rear trap, a 30 sec walk south west of resistance sapper. No aggro, no sneak or invis needed. Northwest Trap: From the Pulse Martello, go west, then northwest, following the wall. The trap is west of the Miasma blockade West Trap: go to Veridical Conflux #2. Travel northwest until you come upon the Rear Trap.

nodes.title: You will be asked to stand a certain distance from the trap - 1 to 5 yalms - away before infusing th
nodes.description: You will be asked to stand a certain distance from the trap - 1 to 5 yalms - away before infusing the trap. 1 yalm is partly inside the fringe of the trap. 2 yalms means you are next to the trap without touching it. 5 yalms means you are at the edge of distance to examine it. (Target is too far away, etc...)

nodes.title: Infuse the trap and return to the Resistance Sapper.
nodes.description: Infuse the trap and return to the Resistance Sapper.

nodes.description: Talk to the Resistance Sapper to obtain the trap refill fluid.

nodes.description: Travel to the nearest Rear Trap. (The nearest is just a few steps behind the NPC, coming from abyssea entrance)

nodes.title: 'Talk' the trap once to activate the refill mode.
nodes.description: 'Talk' the trap once to activate the refill mode.

nodes.title: The trap will inform you to stay a random amount of yalms away from it before 'talking' to it again.
nodes.description: The trap will inform you to stay a random amount of yalms away from it before 'talking' to it again

nodes.title: Walk away the distance specified in the previous step and select 'begin refilling process' from the
nodes.description: Walk away the distance specified in the previous step and select 'begin refilling process' from the choice menu 1 yalm is partly inside the fringe of the trap. 2 yalms means you are next to the trap without touching it. 5 yalms means you are at the edge of distance to examine it. (Target is too far away, etc...)

nodes.title: The closer you are to the specified distance, the more liquid you will be able to pour in the trap a
nodes.description: The closer you are to the specified distance, the more liquid you will be able to pour in the trap and the more Cruor and Resistance Credits you will obtain. This seem to vary from 30~70 Resistance Credits and 100~1500 Cruor

nodes.description: Complete the mission: Crimson Carpet I (Vunkerl)

nodes.title: Talk to the Resistance Sapper (F-9).
nodes.description: Talk to the Resistance Sapper (F-9). He is 10 yalms West of Verdical Conflux #00.

nodes.title: There are three Fore Traps: Western Trap: go to Veridical Conflux #2.
nodes.description: There are three Fore Traps: Western Trap: go to Veridical Conflux #2. Travel northwest until you come upon the Rear Trap. Take a left (southwest). Among the Rift Dragons, next to the west wall, on the border of (E-8) (E-9) is the Fore Trap. Southern Trap: head south past the Rear Trap, head southeast. At (F-10) near Defile Scorpions. Northwestern Trap: border of (E-6) and (E-7), along the wall. Between the Chasm Gnat and Inugami areas. Nearest Veridical Conflux #4.

nodes.title: Infuse the trap.
nodes.description: Infuse the trap. When you start the process you are told how far you have to move away from the Fore Trap before you infuse it: "Please stand X yalms away then commence the process." X can vary from 1-4 yalms. If you don't like the distance, choose to cease it in the next menu and try again. The distance randomly changes every time you do this (can still get the same distance again).

nodes.description: Trade the casket to Veit. Sometimes, he refuses the casket, and you must obtain another. This can happen on both your first completion of the quest and repeat completions.

nodes.title: Defeat all 6 known subspecies of caturae.
nodes.description: Defeat all 6 known subspecies of caturae.

nodes.title: Obtaining the title associated with each NM is necessary to advance.
nodes.description: Obtaining the title associated with each NM is necessary to advance. Players must be within experience points range when it is defeated in order to receive the title. K.O.'d players will still receive the title. It is possible to defeat any or all caturae before the start of this quest. If you have done this, you may check if you have the title(s) by talking with the bard npc Zuah Lepahnyu in Port Jeuno (J-8)- next to the Kazham Airship entrance. But you do not need to re-equip each title to advance the quest.

nodes.title: Obtain three Anti-Abyssean grenades from Fontoumant.
nodes.description: Obtain three Anti-Abyssean grenades from Fontoumant.

nodes.title: Travel to three Dark Fissures and toss in the grenades to destroy the Abyssean threat.
nodes.description: Travel to three Dark Fissures and toss in the grenades to destroy the Abyssean threat. One of the Dark Fissures (H-6) is located on the valley floor in the same chasm as the Central Encampment; travel further down the ramp and look for a group of Pasture Funguars, nearby is the Dark Fissure. The other two Dark Fissures are located in the chasm at (F-6) & (F-7), the same chasm which would normally lead to Ordelle's Caves, travel to the valley floor once more and continue on the pathway to Ordelle's Caves, along the way you will see two Dark Fissures. Occasionally when using the anti-Abyssean grenades on the Dark Fissures, you may receive a message declaring that you have destroyed one of the Abyssean creatures residing inside; you will receive experience points (~221-350) for the monster you destroyed. The probability of this event is unknown; however, it is not necessary for completion of the quest. Defeating a monster gives the following text, even if damage display in the log is turned off: (Name) casts anti-Abyssean grenade #0X into the fissure.The anti-Abyssean grenade scores a critical hit!The unidentified creature takes 9999 damage.(Name) defeats the unidentified creature.(Name) gains 350 experience points. Beware of the Pasture Funguar and the Cankercap (sound) and Hadal Gigas (sight) enroute to completing this quest.

nodes.title: Return to Fontoumant for your reward.
nodes.description: Return to Fontoumant for your reward.

nodes.description: Speak with Teigero-Bangero in Abyssea - Vunkerl (E-7) to receive a Smudged Letter.

nodes.description: Speak with Naruru in Abyssea - Attohwa (G-10) to receive a Yellow Linkpearl.

nodes.description: Return to Teigero-Bangero and talk to him to receive a Taru Tot Toyset. The quest is now complete.

nodes.title: Trade 3 Clionid Wings to Secodiand (A) to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Trade 3 Clionid Wings to Secodiand (A) to complete the quest. Clionid Wings can be obtained from Clionidae or from the Auction House under Others>Misc. Rank 6 fame can be obtained from this quest alone using about 120 Clionid Wings.

nodes.title: After completing Dawn of Death, Joachim asks you to travel to the stone circle in La Theine Plateau
nodes.description: After completing Dawn of Death, Joachim asks you to travel to the stone circle in La Theine Plateau between dusk and dawn (18:00-5:00) to meet a mystery man.

nodes.title: Click on the ??? at (G-6) in La Theine Plateau for a cutscene (not Abyssea - La Theine) This cutscen
nodes.description: Click on the ??? at (G-6) in La Theine Plateau for a cutscene (not Abyssea - La Theine) This cutscene takes priority over the first cutscene of Waking the Beast; you will not be forced to accept or re-flag Waking the Beast to complete this quest.

nodes.title: Talk to Brutus, next to Veridical Conflux #08.
nodes.description: Talk to Brutus, next to Veridical Conflux #08. To get to Brutus, either use Conflux #08, or walk to Red Ghost (H-8) who can teleport you to the top of the ledge, next to Alrauverat.

nodes.title: Take the Gysahl Greens that Brutus gives you to the Chocobo Spoor at (I-8) or (J-10).
nodes.description: Take the Gysahl Greens that Brutus gives you to the Chocobo Spoor at (I-8) or (J-10). The (I-8) Chocobo Spoor is located between the Chasm Coeurls and Amuckatrices. Both are aggressive to sight. The quickest and cheapest way to get there from Brutus is to simply run southeast out of the tunnel. The (J-10) Chocobo Spoor is located between the AT-03 Martello and the Ignis Erucas. You can reach it by Conflux #07 or #03.

nodes.title: Trade the Gysahl Greens to the Chocobo Spoor and it will tell you, "You'd best observe from a distan
nodes.description: Trade the Gysahl Greens to the Chocobo Spoor and it will tell you, "You'd best observe from a distance..."

nodes.title: Run a short ways from the Chocobo Spoor and a Chocobo will spawn close by.
nodes.description: Run a short ways from the Chocobo Spoor and a Chocobo will spawn close by. It will run around, stop, spin a couple times, and then run to another location.

nodes.title: Approach when it has its back to you and click on it from behind to get the message, "You've caught
nodes.description: Approach when it has its back to you and click on it from behind to get the message, "You've caught yourself a chocobo!" The Chocobo seems to have a very narrow line of sight, approaching from the side works fine. The Chocobo has a distinct pattern, usually a dash, then a long look away, then a small trot, quickly followed by a turn (don't try during this phase as it always turns as you come up to it then back to the dash, repeated.) It also only walks/runs to 4 locations around the Spoor and will only face particular directions at each spot, using this information it's pattern is easily observed, once you get it, it becomes laughingly easy to catch. If you approach when it is facing you, it will say, "Kweh!?", be spooked, and run off to a new location. The Chocobo may randomly run deep into the Coeurls or chasm tunnels and disappear. There are two "levels" of spooking the chocobo. If you click it while its looking at you, it will say "Kweeeh Kweeeh!" and run away, to my experience into the Coeurls. The "Kweeeh Kweeh" message is received if you click the chocobo after it is already spooked. if you get the Kweh Kweh message twice before it de-spawns it will stop and go back to the normal area. you can have another chance to finish the quest if it does not see you on the way back. If this happens, you must obtain a new bunch of Gysahl Greens on your own to try again. Changing area does not reset it. Having some Gysahl Greens in store makes unnecessary running around unneeded. Alternatively, one could accept the Resistance Operation Desert Rain II (Attohwa) or Ward Warden II (Attohwa) and purchase more Gysahl Greens from the Chocobo Tamer.

nodes.title: Return to Brutus to complete the quest and receive your reward(s).
nodes.description: Return to Brutus to complete the quest and receive your reward(s).

nodes.title: Talk to Baha Mannohl (A) to start the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Baha Mannohl (A) to start the quest. She's close to Veridical Conflux #5; head east after appearing at #5.

nodes.title: Head to F-6 at night (18:00-6:00) and examine the Tahrongi Cactus to obtain a Cup of Tahrongi cactus
nodes.description: Head to F-6 at night (18:00-6:00) and examine the Tahrongi Cactus to obtain a Cup of Tahrongi cactus water. The fastest way is to head to Veridical Conflux #4. Note: The cactus is located amid the Caoineag so make sure your HP is white and you have sneak up. Also, the Cup of Tahrongi cactus water can only be obtained when this quest is flagged, so you must talk to Baha before you head to the cactus.

nodes.title: Return to Baha Mannohl to finish the quest.
nodes.description: Return to Baha Mannohl to finish the quest. Finish the quest 5 times (must reenter each time) to obtain the Viridian Abyssite of Lenity. Upon finishing the quest the 5th time, zone out and return to Baha Mannohl once more to obtain the abyssite. After completing this quest five times, you can no longer repeat it.

nodes.description: Talk with Naruru at the base camp.

nodes.description: Head to (H-8) and check the Cargo Crate (near Veridical Conflux #6, just past the Spuks).

nodes.description: After obtaining the Damaged Stewpot, return to Naruru.

nodes.description: Speak with Guilboire (F-7, Conflux #07) to start the quest.

nodes.description: Make yourself invisible to avoid Golem aggro and avoid True Sight Sisyphus NM, head to the Impact Point at (G-5), buff up, and click on it to spawn Frost Bomb Mk II.

nodes.title: Run towards the Frost Bomb Mk II and engage it away from the Impact Point.
nodes.description: Run towards the Frost Bomb Mk II and engage it away from the Impact Point. All damage dealt heals the Frost Bomb Mk II.

nodes.title: Bring its HP above 50% and then pull it back to the Impact Point.
nodes.description: Bring its HP above 50% and then pull it back to the Impact Point. It's not immune to Break, and since all attacks are curing it, the effect lasts for the full duration.

nodes.title: It will perform Hypothermal Combustion on the Impact Point, but it deals NO damage to you.
nodes.description: It will perform Hypothermal Combustion on the Impact Point, but it deals NO damage to you.

nodes.description: Touch the Impact Point again to receive a Frosted snoll reflector.

nodes.description: Return to Guilboire to complete the quest and receive your reward. You must zone out before Guilboire will offer you the quest again.

nodes.description: Talk to Julio located at Camp Courage (F-9) (use Conflux#02 and go NW) to start the quest. Rose on the Heath does not need to be fully completed for this, as long as you delivered Captain Rashid's linkpearl you can talk to Julio to start the quest.

nodes.description: Trade him 3 Purple Polypores for your reward.

nodes.description: Head out to Conflux #02 and talk to Kurou-Morou (NW of Martello, (I-12)) who will tell you an item and location. Scuff Mark Locations

nodes.description: Kurou-Morou will ask for 1 of 3 Goblin-related items, all of which can be bought from Pawkrix in Lower Jeuno (H-10) in the back of Muckvix's Junk Shop, and will give you a vague description of a location: Goblin Bread Goblin Pie Goblin Chocolate 'Near Abundance of Water' (top right/ne corner of F-11) (Conflux #04) 'Dark and Cramped' (K-12) 'A Narrow Pathway' (bottom right/se corner of F-13)

nodes.title: Go to that location and trade the item mentioned to the Scuff Mark to make Ramblix appear, talk, and
nodes.description: Go to that location and trade the item mentioned to the Scuff Mark to make Ramblix appear, talk, and dissapear. The item will be lost, unlike when trading to a Goblin Footprint to make Ramblix appear outside of Abyssea.

nodes.description: At this point go to the ending NPC Cornelia (Near Conflux #04). You will need to zone out to repeat this.

nodes.title: Talk to Amaura (A), who requests a Sunbeam fragment.
nodes.description: Talk to Amaura (A), who requests a Sunbeam fragment.

nodes.title: From Veridical Conflux #07, head west to the southeast-most corner of (J-6) (against the cliff edge)
nodes.description: From Veridical Conflux #07, head west to the southeast-most corner of (J-6) (against the cliff edge) and find the spot Jagged Cliff (daytime only, 6:00~18:00). Complete the minigame 'Bungee Jumping' to acquire a Sunbeam fragment. Grab the fragment a little later when you're bouncing back up to successfully grab it. You are allowed only three attempts to snatch the Sunbeam Fragment.

nodes.title: Return to Amaura (A) for your reward (even if you failed).
nodes.description: Return to Amaura (A) for your reward (even if you failed). A Hi-Reraiser is given after every success. Hi-Reraisers are and therefore you must somehow dispose of any previous Hi-Reraiser in your inventory before completing this quest. The Sunbeam fragment remains with you if you have to zone and get rid of a previous Hi-Reraiser. A sturdy pyxis with a status enhancement has appeared on first-time success.

nodes.title: Talk with Harith in the base camp to receive a Miasmal counteragent recipe.
nodes.description: Talk with Harith in the base camp to receive a Miasmal counteragent recipe. Examine the key item to reveal the recipe for a Miasmal counteragent.

nodes.title: Synthesize the Miasmal Counteragent; it is Alchemy but can be made with zero skill.
nodes.description: Synthesize the Miasmal Counteragent; it is Alchemy but can be made with zero skill. You must have received the key item for the synthesis to work.

nodes.title: Find one of the miasma clouds that block paths in the area, target it, and trade one Miasmal Counter
nodes.description: Find one of the miasma clouds that block paths in the area, target it, and trade one Miasmal Counteragent- the miasma stream will dissipate and you can walk through it. Most on the mountain in the area are untargetable and can't be used. IMPORTANT: You only need to trade one item. You receive no message upon trading the item, but as long as you lose one, the item worked and you are done.

nodes.title: Locations Miasma Clouds have been spotted.
nodes.description: Locations Miasma Clouds have been spotted.

nodes.title: The targeted name is "Dark Miasma" (E-7) (E-8) (J-8) (J-9) near the Taru Resistance Fighter on Parra
nodes.description: The targeted name is "Dark Miasma" (E-7) (E-8) (J-8) (J-9) near the Taru Resistance Fighter on Parradamo Tor (J-10) (K-9) right next to Veridical Conflux #07

nodes.title: Return to Harith for your reward.
nodes.description: Return to Harith for your reward.

nodes.title: You can synthesize many Miasmal Counteragents to remove miasma that is blocking paths once you have
nodes.description: You can synthesize many Miasmal Counteragents to remove miasma that is blocking paths once you have flagged this quest.

nodes.title: Quest will be flagged upon completion of An Officer and a Pirate.
nodes.description: Quest will be flagged upon completion of An Officer and a Pirate.

nodes.title: Complete a total of five Abyssea Main Quests and then speak to Joachim to complete this quest and au
nodes.description: Complete a total of five Abyssea Main Quests and then speak to Joachim to complete this quest and automatically flag the next.

nodes.title: Speak to Ken to begin the quest.
nodes.description: Speak to Ken to begin the quest.

nodes.title: Obtain a Soulgauger SGR-1 from one Lined Casket and buy Blank Gauger Plates for 5 cruor each from th
nodes.description: Obtain a Soulgauger SGR-1 from one Lined Casket and buy Blank Gauger Plates for 5 cruor each from the other.

nodes.title: Find any notorious monster.
nodes.description: Find any notorious monster. With the Soulgauger and plates equipped, use the Soulgauger SGR-1 to capture the image. Plates can be rejected if the Notorious monster had too few HP when the image was captured. Notorious monsters are not limited to Altepa, but are limited to Heroes of Abyssea zones. Ken accepts plates from non-Heroes monsters, but awards less cruor (350 instead of 500), and you may not have a chance to earn a seal.

nodes.title: Return and trade the plate to Ken for your reward.
nodes.description: Return and trade the plate to Ken for your reward.

nodes.title: Speak with Cornelia (near Veridical Conflux #04) at G-12 who asks you to bring her a Pursuer's Wing.
nodes.description: Speak with Cornelia (near Veridical Conflux #04) at G-12 who asks you to bring her a Pursuer's Wing. You must zone after completing Getting Lucky to be able to flag this quest.

nodes.title: Obtain a Pursuer's Wing from defeating Faunus Wyverns, buying from the Auction House, or unlocking a
nodes.description: Obtain a Pursuer's Wing from defeating Faunus Wyverns, buying from the Auction House, or unlocking a Gold Sturdy Pyxis in Abyssea - Grauberg. Faunus Wyverns can be found north of Veridical Conflux #3. You may want to do Dominion Op 04 (Grauberg) at the same time for extra experience points and a chance at seals.

nodes.description: Trade the Pursuer's Wing to Cornelia for your reward.

nodes.description: After flagging one of the Heroes of Abyssea main quests (An Ulcerous Uragnite, A Beaked Blusterer, A Man-eating Mite) talk to Joachim in Port Jeuno (H-8) to begin this quest.

nodes.description: This quest is semi-independent of the Abyssea quest progression. This quest signifies that you own Heroes of Abyssea and have begun its boss quests. This quest will be marked as complete after you complete An Ulcerous Uragnite, A Beaked Blusterer, and A Man-eating Mite.

nodes.title: After completing all three of the above quests, talk to Joachim again for a closing cutscene.
nodes.description: After completing all three of the above quests, talk to Joachim again for a closing cutscene.

nodes.description: Talk to Kupipi (A) at the Central Encampment.

nodes.description: Talk to Kopuro-Popuro (A) at the Western Encampment (F-9) (Conflux #03) and click on the Bottomless Box. He'll tell you to be cheerful to his box (try various happy emotes like /joy, /cheer, /smile, to the Bottomless Box. /dance1 through 4 also work)

nodes.title: Kopro-Popuro gives you 2 clues, and you have to do those 3-4 emotes to the bottomless box 3 times.
nodes.description: Kopro-Popuro gives you 2 clues, and you have to do those 3-4 emotes to the bottomless box 3 times. The emotes are working if the bottomless box gives you a different reason why it doesn't have the ripe starfruit.

nodes.description: It should give you a Ripe starfruit.

nodes.description: Take it back to Apururu to receive 200 cruor.

nodes.description: Talk to Cheupirudaux (A) at the Western Encampment (E-7) (west of Conflux #08, across the bridge and southwest, through the gate) to recieve a Woodworker's Belt. If this is your first time flagging the quest, he also gives you one or two jars of Viscous Spittle.

nodes.description: With those in hand, proceed to the bridge directly northeast (on the way to Veridical Conflux #8) and examine the bridge.

nodes.description: Check the woodworker's belt, and trade the correct amount of spittle to the bridge to complete the quest. Two Viscous Spittle if it creaks Four Viscous Spittle if it wavers Five Viscous Spittle if it crumbles

nodes.description: Return to Cheupirudaux (A) for your reward.

nodes.description: It is possible to receive no seals.

nodes.description: Repeating this quest requires you to farm your own Viscous Spittle from Spitting Spiders. Also, different bridge repair locations can be used in order to complete this quest from the second attempt onwards.

nodes.title: It is possible to repair more than one bridge in the same run after the first completion.
nodes.description: It is possible to repair more than one bridge in the same run after the first completion. The amount of cruor obtained varies from 150 for a single bridge, or 850 for all four. It is not known if the number of bridges repaired affects fame or seal drops.

nodes.description: Talk to the Moogle (A) near Veridical Conflux #07 to begin the quest.

nodes.description: Flag the quest at Ayame (A) (Base Camp), who wants you to collect 3 key items in order to repair the barriers. These can be found in Repair Trunks scattered about the encampment (including behind the maw and past the ward). Once you have obtained all three items, talk to Raibaht (A), who is standing next to the Searing Ward.

nodes.description: Trade him a Lilac and he will ask you to put in on the grave to the south east.

nodes.title: Go to the Grassy Mound at (K-12), south of Conflux #08, and trade the lilac.
nodes.description: Go to the Grassy Mound at (K-12), south of Conflux #08, and trade the lilac.

nodes.title: Return to Goraow (A) for your reward.
nodes.description: Return to Goraow (A) for your reward.

nodes.title: Talk to Tyamah (A) at F-7 Veridical Conflux 7 to start the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Tyamah (A) at F-7 Veridical Conflux 7 to start the quest.

nodes.title: Talk to the 4 npc's.
nodes.description: Talk to the 4 npc's. Purere (A) at the same outpost Veridical Conflux 7. Latifah (A) at the second outpost Veridical Conflux 6. Valderotaux (A) at the first outpost Veridical Conflux 5. Polly (A) at the base camp Veridical Conflux 1.

nodes.title: Return to Tyamah (A) Veridical Conflux 7 for your reward.
nodes.description: Return to Tyamah (A) Veridical Conflux 7 for your reward.

nodes.title: You must zone after completing Imperial Espionage to begin this quest.
nodes.description: You must zone after completing Imperial Espionage to begin this quest.

nodes.title: Talk to Tyamah (A) at Veridical Conflux 7.
nodes.description: Talk to Tyamah (A) at Veridical Conflux 7. He will ask for pictures of "abnormal, unnatural Abyssean fiends." He requires pictures of all four mobs unique to Abyssea. Floe Amoeban Range Clionid Iceberg Murex Crag Limule. Get a Soulgauger SGR-1 and Blank Gauger Plate from the boxes next to him. Floe Amoeban and Iceberg Murex are found at the base of the mountain at G-10 (between Veridical Conflux 1 and Veridical Conflux 2 ). Range Clionid are found in the tunnels via Veridical Conflux 3 . Crag Limule are be found by sliding down the mountain to the holes at F-8 or G-9. These are the same holes for Slip Slidin' Away

nodes.title: Use Soulgauger SGR-1 and Blank Gauger Plate on a mob when it is directly facing you.
nodes.description: Use Soulgauger SGR-1 and Blank Gauger Plate on a mob when it is directly facing you.

nodes.title: You must weaken the fiends in order to get a successful picture.
nodes.description: You must weaken the fiends in order to get a successful picture. After each successful turn-in, he will confirm that it is one of the mobs he is looking for, but say "But there are more! Yes, still more!" He will not always accept plates and will tell you to do it again. He will inform you of your error if you attempt to trade in a repeat picture. He will not return the gauger plate of the repeat picture.

nodes.title: Once all four types have been turned in, he will say, "Yes, these are unmistakeably the fiends that
nodes.description: Once all four types have been turned in, he will say, "Yes, these are unmistakeably the fiends that I was looking for..." and reward you with the Cruor and the Abyssite.

nodes.title: Talk to Zauko (K-9, Conflux #05) to flag the quest, then examine the Coal Casket behind him for the
nodes.description: Talk to Zauko (K-9, Conflux #05) to flag the quest, then examine the Coal Casket behind him for the Torch Coal.

nodes.title: Walk to the second encampment (by conflux #06) and place the coal into the Coal Casket next to the f
nodes.description: Walk to the second encampment (by conflux #06) and place the coal into the Coal Casket next to the flames. The Torch Coal is destroyed when you use a conflux, so you must walk to each encampment.

nodes.title: Then walk to the third encampment (by conflux #07) and place the coal into the Coal Casket next to t
nodes.description: Then walk to the third encampment (by conflux #07) and place the coal into the Coal Casket next to the flames.

nodes.title: You can then conflux back to Zauko for your reward.
nodes.description: You can then conflux back to Zauko for your reward.

nodes.title: Baldric (A) (Second Outpost (J-5)) near Conflux 6 asks you to find three Fresh Snowfall, and place t
nodes.description: Baldric (A) (Second Outpost (J-5)) near Conflux 6 asks you to find three Fresh Snowfall, and place the Subniveal Mines in them. Depending on the size of the Fresh Snowfall you will need to put more or less Firesand into the mine. For areas with more snowfall, you need less Firesand and areas with less snowfall, you need more Firesand.

nodes.title: The 3 Fresh Snowfalls are in the area in and around (K-7).
nodes.description: The 3 Fresh Snowfalls are in the area in and around (K-7). If you start at Conflux #05, and run northwest, you should come across all 3 (run more to the west to find the third one, right next to zone boss pop area).

nodes.title: Speak to Alisa, Fourth Outpost (D-11) (Conflux #08), to reobtain the Moon Pendant from the previous
nodes.description: Speak to Alisa, Fourth Outpost (D-11) (Conflux #08), to reobtain the Moon Pendant from the previous quest. You must zone out after completing Motherly Love in order to start this quest.

nodes.title: Click the ??? at (D-11) near the Surveyors and Zacc (A) and Enu (A) will appear and speak to you.
nodes.description: Click the ??? at (D-11) near the Surveyors and Zacc (A) and Enu (A) will appear and speak to you.

nodes.title: Click the ??? again to obtain the Emerald Abyssite of Expertise.
nodes.description: Click the ??? again to obtain the Emerald Abyssite of Expertise.

nodes.title: Speak to Alisa to finish the quest.
nodes.description: Speak to Alisa to finish the quest.

nodes.title: Speak to Colti at (H-8) near Veridical Conflux #8.
nodes.description: Speak to Colti at (H-8) near Veridical Conflux #8. She will give you 5 Parradamo Supply Pack. You must give these to 5 NPCs found around Parradamo Tor. You do not lose the Parradamo Supply Packs if you zone, use a Conflux, etc. If you die or timeout in the middle of this quest, your progress remains.

nodes.title: This is one route for climbing Paradamo Tor.
nodes.description: This is one route for climbing Paradamo Tor. It takes approximately 5 minutes. Other routes are possible, and stay away from the top of the Tor if you fear Yaanei. This is one method that seems faster than some others.

nodes.title: Talk to Halver (A) near Conflux #06, who asks for two Lambent Scales.
nodes.description: Talk to Halver (A) near Conflux #06, who asks for two Lambent Scales.

nodes.title: Get two Lambent Scales from Farfadets at G/H-6 by the Central Encampment(Conflux #4) and return to H
nodes.description: Get two Lambent Scales from Farfadets at G/H-6 by the Central Encampment(Conflux #4) and return to Halver.

nodes.title: Trade the two Lambent Scales to Halver (A) to complete the quest and obtain a Vial of lambent potion
nodes.description: Trade the two Lambent Scales to Halver (A) to complete the quest and obtain a Vial of lambent potion and 480 cruor. You can take the Vial of lambent potion to Curilla (A) to start An Eye for Revenge.

nodes.title: Talk to Eight of Clubs (A) at H-8.
nodes.description: Talk to Eight of Clubs (A) at H-8. From (Conflux #5) head southeast with no risk of aggro. You do not need to zone after completing The Mysterious Head Patrol to start this quest.

nodes.title: Go to the northwest corner of J-8 and examine the Faint Glister to obtain an Elegant Gemstone.
nodes.description: Go to the northwest corner of J-8 and examine the Faint Glister to obtain an Elegant Gemstone. This is south of Conflux #8. Beware Glade Wivre aggression.

nodes.title: Return to Eight of Clubs (A) for your reward.
nodes.description: Return to Eight of Clubs (A) for your reward.

nodes.title: After defeating Shinryu, talk to Prishe for a cutscene.
nodes.description: After defeating Shinryu, talk to Prishe for a cutscene.

nodes.title: Return to Port Jeuno and speak to Joachim for another cutscene.
nodes.description: Return to Port Jeuno and speak to Joachim for another cutscene.

nodes.title: After speaking with Joachim, head to the Hall of the Gods between 18:00-5:00 for another cutscene.
nodes.description: After speaking with Joachim, head to the Hall of the Gods between 18:00-5:00 for another cutscene.

nodes.title: Head back to Abyssea - Empyreal Paradox and speak to Prishe for the final cutscene and the Abyssite
nodes.description: Head back to Abyssea - Empyreal Paradox and speak to Prishe for the final cutscene and the Abyssite of the Cosmos.

nodes.title: The quest will automatically flag upon checking the Cavernous Maw in Tahrongi Canyon with a Traverse
nodes.description: The quest will automatically flag upon checking the Cavernous Maw in Tahrongi Canyon with a Traverser Stone in your inventory and Dawn of Death in active quests. If you defeat Glavoid without having the quest flagged, and then flag the quest later, you will automatically complete the quest after re-zoning.

nodes.title: Proceed to I-5, and trade four key items (listed below) to the ??? on the side of a hill to pop Glav
nodes.description: Proceed to I-5, and trade four key items (listed below) to the ??? on the side of a hill to pop Glavoid. Four key items are needed to pop it, but only one person needs to have them: Fat-lined Cockatrice Skin from Alectryon. Sodden Sandworm Husk from Minhocao. Sticky Gnat Wing from Adze. Luxuriant Manticore Mane from Muscaliet.

nodes.title: Kill Glavoid.
nodes.description: Kill Glavoid. It is a difficult battle, so a full alliance is recommended. All members of the alliance will receive credit for the kill. The title is received at this point.

nodes.title: Exit Abyssea - Tahrongi by using the Cavernous Maw or timing out.
nodes.description: Exit Abyssea - Tahrongi by using the Cavernous Maw or timing out.

nodes.title: Note: Any zone from somewhere to Tahrongi Canyon will work.
nodes.description: Note: Any zone from somewhere to Tahrongi Canyon will work.

nodes.title: Talk to Iron Eater at Base Camp (V.
nodes.description: Talk to Iron Eater at Base Camp (V. Conflux #01) to receive Iron Eater's pearlsack. Talk to Fariel (G-8): Small path south of V. Conflux #06. Talk to Quasim (G-5): North of V. Conflux #05. Use Sneak to get by the crabs and flies. Go past the bridge and turn right. Talk to Mathurin (G-7): Small path near V. Conflux #03.

nodes.title: Return to Iron Eater for your reward.
nodes.description: Return to Iron Eater for your reward.

nodes.title: Talk to Alisa, Fourth Outpost (D-11) (Conflux #08), to begin the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Alisa, Fourth Outpost (D-11) (Conflux #08), to begin the quest.

nodes.title: Talk to Malene, who mentions Bugul Noz.
nodes.description: Talk to Malene, who mentions Bugul Noz. You may receive the Moon Pendant without talking to Malene but will be unable to continue with the quest upon returning to Alisa until you speak to Malene.

nodes.title: Have one alliance member trade Sabulous Clay to the ??? at (E-10) to spawn Bugul Noz.
nodes.description: Have one alliance member trade Sabulous Clay to the ??? at (E-10) to spawn Bugul Noz.

nodes.title: Defeat Bugul Noz to obtain a Moon Pendant.
nodes.description: Defeat Bugul Noz to obtain a Moon Pendant.

nodes.title: Speak with Alisa.
nodes.description: Speak with Alisa.

nodes.title: Speak with Malene to complete the quest and obtain your reward.
nodes.description: Speak with Malene to complete the quest and obtain your reward.

nodes.title: Speak with Raibaht (A) at the base encampment and he will give you a Vat of martello fuel to go and
nodes.description: Speak with Raibaht (A) at the base encampment and he will give you a Vat of martello fuel to go and refuel the Martellos.

nodes.title: The Martello is located just past the ward.
nodes.description: The Martello is located just past the ward.

nodes.title: First you choose to start replenishing.
nodes.description: First you choose to start replenishing. When checking again you get a choice to replenish from a direction (aka North, East). Choose that option. When successful the message will be something like: The martell's energy has recovered by 200! The replenishment effort was an unparalleled success! This quest is a practice for the Refuel and Replenish quests. In this quest alone, the Martello does not have to be missing a certain amount of energy to be refueled.

nodes.title: Report back to Raibaht (A) to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Report back to Raibaht (A) to complete the quest.

nodes.title: This quest cannot be repeated.
nodes.description: This quest cannot be repeated. It is a practice quest. The next quest, Refuel and Replenish (Konschtat), can be repeated.

nodes.title: Speak to Glenne (A) to receive a Rainbow-colored linkpearl to deliver to Aaveleon (A).
nodes.description: Speak to Glenne (A) to receive a Rainbow-colored linkpearl to deliver to Aaveleon (A). Glenne is located at (L-11), near Conflux #06.

nodes.title: Find Aaveleon and speak to him.
nodes.description: Find Aaveleon and speak to him. He has been sighted all over La Theine, including (D-7) going east, (E-7), (F-7) heading down into the gigas area from (E-7), (H-9), (H-11), (I-8), (I-10), (J-8), (J-9), (G-10) and (G-11). He can also head east from the central encampment (H-7), circle around the cliffs at (I-8)/(I-9), and then travel south to the ravine at (H-10). Widescan makes locating him much easier.

nodes.title: Return to Glenne to complete the quest and obtain your reward.
nodes.description: Return to Glenne to complete the quest and obtain your reward.

nodes.title: Go to Naji at (J-5).
nodes.description: Go to Naji at (J-5). Veridical Conflux 8 then go south to the west side, against the cliff near the Martello. Naji appears faded, as a player does who has Invisible (Status Effect) on.

nodes.title: Talk to Naji to give him Naji's Linkpearl and start the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Naji to give him Naji's Linkpearl and start the quest.

nodes.title: Turn in a Gauger Plate of (Kukulkan, Turul, Fistule, Bloodeye Vileberry, or Eccentric Eve) to Naji f
nodes.description: Turn in a Gauger Plate of (Kukulkan, Turul, Fistule, Bloodeye Vileberry, or Eccentric Eve) to Naji for your reward. Turul, as the only free popping NM accepted by Naji, is the easiest target to use for this quest. Fistule is also an easy option for this quest and doesnt aggro. If Guimauve and Fistule are both alive, you can easily drag Guimauve over to Fistule, let it get eaten, and take your picture. You do not need to have claim on the NM when you record the image onto the Gauger Plate. Your image should be taken at close range and face-to-face with the creature to qualify.

nodes.title: Defeat the notorious monster Waugyl at F-9.
nodes.description: Defeat the notorious monster Waugyl at F-9. All members of the alliance who have flagged the quest will receive the Waugyl's Claw.

nodes.title: Speak to the Machine Outfitter at Base Camp to log this quest.
nodes.description: Speak to the Machine Outfitter at Base Camp to log this quest. If you zone at any point during this quest, you will lose all progress and key items needed to complete it.

nodes.title: There are eight martellos scattered throughout the zone.
nodes.description: There are eight martellos scattered throughout the zone. It is now possible to complete this quest even the martello's HP is at 100%.

nodes.title: Return to the Machine Outfitter at Base Camp to complete this quest.
nodes.description: Return to the Machine Outfitter at Base Camp to complete this quest. You can do the quest only once per Vana'diel day, but may require zoning.

nodes.description: Return to the Machine Outfitter at Base Camp to complete this quest. You can do the quest only once per Vana'diel day, but may require zoning.

nodes.description: Note: The Martello must be below 90% of maximum capacity to receive the option to refuel it.

nodes.title: Choose to start replenishing.
nodes.description: Choose to start replenishing.

nodes.title: Choose to replenish from the direction offered.
nodes.description: Choose to replenish from the direction offered. The direction affects the reward you get. Northwest recovers 100 East recovers 200

nodes.title: On discovering a Martello you must examine it and select the option to replenish fuel.
nodes.description: On discovering a Martello you must examine it and select the option to replenish fuel. you will be asked to stand on a specific side of the Martello to replenish it. After replenishment you will be given an Empty fuel vat, which you must then return to the Machine Outfitter to complete the quest. If for any reason you exit Abyssea - La Theine, you will lose the Vat of martello fuel or the Empty fuel vat depending on which you have aquired. A Martello must be below 90% of maximum capacity to receive the option to refuel it.

nodes.description: Martello Locations: LT-01 Martello D-4 LT-02 Martello D-8 LT-03 Martello G-5 LT-04 Martello F-9 LT-05 Martello H-7 LT-06 Martello I-9 LT-07 Martello L-11

nodes.description: Speak to the Machine Outfitter at Base Camp to log this quest. If you zone at any point during this quest, you will lose all progress and key items needed to complete it.

nodes.description: There are eight martellos scattered throughout the zone; you can only replenish a martello if its "health" is below 90%. You can drain its energy by having it heal you, but can only do this once per a set amount of time.

nodes.description: Return to the Machine Outfitter at Base Camp to complete this quest. You can do the quest only once per Vana'diel day, but may require zoning.

nodes.description: You must first speak with Kupipi before the Machine Outfitter will give you the quest.

nodes.description: The Martello must be below 90% of maximum capacity to receive the option to refuel it.

nodes.description: There are eight martello's scattered throughout the zone; you can only replenish a martello if it's "health" is below 90%. You can drain it's energy by having it heal you, but can only do this once per a set amount of time.

nodes.title: Return to the Machine Outfitter at Base Camp to complete this quest.
nodes.description: Return to the Machine Outfitter at Base Camp to complete this quest. You can do the quest only once per Vana'Diel day, but may require zoning.

nodes.title: Talk to Ayame (A) at base camp to begin the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Ayame (A) at base camp to begin the quest.

nodes.title: Talk to: Rashid (A) at the Martello, bottom right hand corner of (F-9) (Conflux #02)Argus (A) at (D-
nodes.description: Talk to: Rashid (A) at the Martello, bottom right hand corner of (F-9) (Conflux #02)Argus (A) at (D-7) (Conflux #03)Helga (A) at SE corner of (G-5) (Conflux #06)

nodes.title: Report back to Ayame (A) at base camp to receive your reward.
nodes.description: Report back to Ayame (A) at base camp to receive your reward. Doing so will then allow you to accept new quests from NPCs at each of the camps you delivered pearls to.

nodes.title: Speak to Piketo-Puketo (A) (Conflux #03) Western Encampment (F-9) to receive a Vial of flower-wower
nodes.description: Speak to Piketo-Puketo (A) (Conflux #03) Western Encampment (F-9) to receive a Vial of flower-wower fertilizer.

nodes.title: Head east-southeast from Conflux #04 to the large tree at the borderline of G/H-7.
nodes.description: Head east-southeast from Conflux #04 to the large tree at the borderline of G/H-7.

nodes.title: Go down on the path below and find a Gnarled Root; check it to apply the fertilizer.
nodes.description: Go down on the path below and find a Gnarled Root; check it to apply the fertilizer. You will get a message telling you that you've heard something drop beside you. To save yourself from having to fall into the path, and to save time, you can walk out onto a tree root to reach the Gnarled Root from above.

nodes.title: Now trek just slightly up the ledge to the tree above and check the Fragmented Nutshell to receive a
nodes.description: Now trek just slightly up the ledge to the tree above and check the Fragmented Nutshell to receive a Tahrongi tree nut.

nodes.title: Return it to Piketo-Puketo (A) at F-9 for a 200-cruor reward.
nodes.description: Return it to Piketo-Puketo (A) at F-9 for a 200-cruor reward. Repeating this quest 7 times will take you from Fame 2 to 3, and 9 more repeats after will move to you Fame 4.

nodes.title: After flagging one of the Scars of Abyssea main quests (A Fluttery Fiend, A Delectable Demon, The Be
nodes.description: After flagging one of the Scars of Abyssea main quests (A Fluttery Fiend, A Delectable Demon, The Beast of Bastore) talk to Joachim in Port Jeuno (H-8) to begin this quest.

nodes.title: This quest is semi-independent of the Abyssea quest progression.
nodes.description: This quest is semi-independent of the Abyssea quest progression. This quest signifies that you own Scars of Abyssea and have begun its boss quests. This quest will be marked as complete after you complete A Fluttery Fiend, A Delectable Demon, and The Beast of Bastore.

nodes.title: After completing all three of the above quests, talk to Joachim again for a closing cutscene.
nodes.description: After completing all three of the above quests, talk to Joachim again for a closing cutscene.

nodes.title: Talk to Aladoverre (A) to begin the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Aladoverre (A) to begin the quest.

nodes.title: You must now find: a Chipped Linkshell, a Cracked Linkshell, and a Grimy Linkshell.
nodes.description: You must now find: a Chipped Linkshell, a Cracked Linkshell, and a Grimy Linkshell. Note: If you die and need to return to your home point, you still retain the key items you have already found.

nodes.title: Talk to Rondipur at the base camp who has lost contact with three scouts.
nodes.description: Talk to Rondipur at the base camp who has lost contact with three scouts.

nodes.title: Use Veridical Conflux 1 to go to Veridical Conflux 7.
nodes.description: Use Veridical Conflux 1 to go to Veridical Conflux 7. Head north among the golem and speak with Cannau who is roaming around in (G-6). Trade her Pea Soup or Emerald Soup and she'll mention that she needs to get in touch with Rondiopur. Pea Soup can be purchased from the Marble Bridge Eatery in Upper Jeuno. It may be out of stock at the Culinarians' Guild (Windurst).

nodes.title: Return to Veridical Conflux 7 and go to Veridical Conflux 6.
nodes.description: Return to Veridical Conflux 7 and go to Veridical Conflux 6. Head west to (I-5). Between the Adasauruses and the Svelldrakes, look for Wanzo-Unzozo who is running around in that area. Speak with him and trade him a Flint Stone. You can obtain a Flint Stone by defeating Ectozoons near Veridical Conflux 5.

nodes.title: Return to Veridical Conflux 6 and go to Veridical Conflux 4.
nodes.description: Return to Veridical Conflux 6 and go to Veridical Conflux 4. Head northeast to (J-10), find and speak with Olavia. She roams in the upper AND lower areas of (J-10). Check the Strewn Carrion target in (J-11) close to the southern wall, upper area (amid the Sierra Tigers). Return to and speak with Olavia.

nodes.title: Return to Rondipur at Base Camp for your reward.
nodes.description: Return to Rondipur at Base Camp for your reward.

nodes.title: Talk to Helga located at Camp Vigilance (G-5).
nodes.description: Talk to Helga located at Camp Vigilance (G-5). Camp Vigilance can be reached one of two ways. Veridical Conflux 5 then straight North through the Wivre area. Veridical Conflux 6 (safer path through leeches that do not aggro) Go slightly southeast (go along the cliff and keep going straight after cliff ends).

nodes.title: Go to Naji at (J-5).
nodes.description: Go to Naji at (J-5). Veridical Conflux 8 then go south to the west side, against the cliff near the Martello. Naji appears faded, as a player does who has Invisible (Status Effect) on. He will give you a Naji's Gauger Plate Key Item and tell you to deliver it to Helga.

nodes.title: Return to Helga to complete the quest and obtain Naji's Linkpearl and an Evolith.
nodes.description: Return to Helga to complete the quest and obtain Naji's Linkpearl and an Evolith.

nodes.title: Unlike the The Soul of the Matter, you must have Rose on the Heath fully completed in order to recei
nodes.description: Unlike the The Soul of the Matter, you must have Rose on the Heath fully completed in order to receive this quest.

nodes.title: Talk to Talib (A) located at D-7 (Take Conflux #3) to start the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Talib (A) located at D-7 (Take Conflux #3) to start the quest.
