nodes.description: Retrieve 4 Limule Pincers from one of the following locations: Sods Limule in Abyssea - Konschtat Gigadaphnia in Abyssea - La Theine Ephemeral Limule in Abyssea - La Theine Auction House

nodes.title: Trade the 4 Limule Pincers to Talib (A) for your reward.
nodes.description: Trade the 4 Limule Pincers to Talib (A) for your reward.

nodes.title: Talk to Bopa Greso (A) (I-10 - SE of Conflux #2) to start the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Bopa Greso (A) (I-10 - SE of Conflux #2) to start the quest.

nodes.title: There are 4 signposts that you need to examine: (G-7) - Southeast of Conflux #04 (H-6) - Just south
nodes.description: There are 4 signposts that you need to examine: (G-7) - Southeast of Conflux #04 (H-6) - Just south of Conflux #06 (H-9) - West of Conflux #02 (I-8) - Northeast of Conflux #02

nodes.title: Talk to Bopa Greso (A) to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Bopa Greso (A) to complete the quest.

nodes.title: You must zone after completing The Titus Touch before you can start this quest.
nodes.description: You must zone after completing The Titus Touch before you can start this quest.

nodes.title: Speak with Michilca (A) to flag the quest.
nodes.description: Speak with Michilca (A) to flag the quest.

nodes.title: Travel to Conflux 7 and proceed South to F8/F9.
nodes.description: Travel to Conflux 7 and proceed South to F8/F9. Be wary of Spectators (sound and magic aggro) and Sub-zero Gears (true sight, true sound, and magic aggro) and possible Chariot Notorious Monsters (Refitted Chariot and Impervious Chariot). If you drop down the South-facing wall (G-9) position yourself approximately 1/3 the length of the ledge from the East wall and drop into a hole on the face to land near a NPC named Nachou (A). If you drop down the West-facing wall, (F-8), position yourself approximately 1/3 the length of the ledge from the North wall and drop into a hole on the face to land near a NPC named Perfaumand (A). Alternately, a possible shortcut is to use Veridical Conflux #3, which is within the tunnel. Once you've used it, proceed south past the Martello, then east at the T-intersection to reach the landing zone for Nachou (A).

nodes.title: Upon completing the dialog with the NPC, rush back out to the ledge and rotate your camera so that y
nodes.description: Upon completing the dialog with the NPC, rush back out to the ledge and rotate your camera so that you're looking up the cliff face. Shortly (within 2-4 seconds), NPCs named "Resistance Fighter" will start very rapidly sliding down the slope, dropping to the left or right of the hole in the ledge face. Tarutaru seem to fall quickest, while Galka seem to be the slowest. You must select them and click on them as they are near you on the ledge. If you are successful, the NPC will scurry up into the hole and disappear down the tunnel. If you fail, they will fall out of sight and vanish. They will come in waves of 2-3 NPCs spaced 1-2 seconds apart followed by a pause of about 3 seconds.

nodes.title: You MUST speak to the NPC (Nachou (A) or Perfaumand (A)) after the last Resistance Fighter has dropp
nodes.description: You MUST speak to the NPC (Nachou (A) or Perfaumand (A)) after the last Resistance Fighter has dropped. You will be told how many you missed and to return to Michilca (A). Six out of ten appears to be the required number of rescues for completion.

nodes.title: If you fail the quest, you must still report to Michilca (A) to report your failure, which cancels t
nodes.description: If you fail the quest, you must still report to Michilca (A) to report your failure, which cancels the quest. You can reaccept it immediately.

nodes.title: Talk to Hungry Wolf at (G-7), Conflux #3.
nodes.description: Talk to Hungry Wolf at (G-7), Conflux #3.

nodes.title: Obtain a Galkan Sausage Cook a Giant Sheep Meat to get the sausage.
nodes.description: Obtain a Galkan Sausage Cook a Giant Sheep Meat to get the sausage. You can either cook the meat using the same method as in Smoke on the Mountain or by using the campfire in Abyssea - Misareaux near Conflux #6.

nodes.title: If you use the campfire in Abyssea - Misareaux, you are given a prompt upon trading the meat to eith
nodes.description: If you use the campfire in Abyssea - Misareaux, you are given a prompt upon trading the meat to either pull it out of the fire or continue cooking, up to three times. If you successfully continue to cook, your Galkan Sausage will HQ, up to +3. If you fail on the first two prompts, you will receive a Galkan Sausage -1 (Appears to be a 50%~ success rate). Failure at the +3 step completely chars the meat, giving you nothing. A large number of clusters and the NM Abyssic Cluster are hanging around the campfire in Abyssea - Misareaux. Use extreme caution when attempting this method. Clusters do not aggro while you are cooking the meat, and trading the meat causes them to deaggro. You may also directly buy a +1/+2/+3 sausage directly from the Auction House.

nodes.title: Trade the sausage to Hungry Wolf for your reward.
nodes.description: Trade the sausage to Hungry Wolf for your reward. The seal you get is random. Current job has no effect on the seal you receive. The type of sausage you trade - be it NQ, +1, +2, or +3 - has no effect on the percentage rate of seal drop or type of seal. It only affects what Hungry Wolf (A) says and the amount of cruor and fame he awards. Trading a plain Galkan Sausage gives 200 Cruor, +1 gives 300 Cruor, +2 gives 400 Cruor and +3 gives 600 Cruor. Trading a Galkan Sausage -1 does not reward you anything. This quest can be repeated upon zoning. Repeating the quest using a Galkan Sausage +3 four times gets you to Fame 2, seven times for Fame 3, eleven times for Fame 4, fourteen times for Fame 5, and seventeen times for Fame 6 (capped).

nodes.title: Talk to Sieglinde (A) near Veridical Conflux #01 to obtain a Mineral gauge for dummies.
nodes.description: Talk to Sieglinde (A) near Veridical Conflux #01 to obtain a Mineral gauge for dummies.

nodes.title: Find a Logging Point and click it.
nodes.description: Find a Logging Point and click it. There are 6 general locations where logging points can be found. Watch for JA aggro from Ephemeral Murex and magic aggro at night from Ephemeral Amoebans randomly roaming any of the logging locations. (I-11) North of Conflux #07 among the Atrociraptors. This is the safest of all locations to look for a Logging Point. (G-5) North of Conflux #05, among the Buzzflies. (F-4) Far north of Conflux #05, over the bridge, among the Boartraps. (G-6) Southeast of Conflux #05, among the Protoamoebans. (E-7) West of Conflux #06 among the Dynamo Clusters. (F-8) South of Conflux #06 among the Observers.

nodes.title: When you click the logging point, it tells you that the light shines blue, yellow, or red.
nodes.description: When you click the logging point, it tells you that the light shines blue, yellow, or red.

nodes.title: Return to Sieglinde (A).
nodes.description: Return to Sieglinde (A). If the light was blue, you complete the quest and receive your reward. If the light was yellow or red, you receive a Tube of alchemical fertilizer. If you received the Tube of alchemical fertilizer, go back to the same Logging Point as before and click it. Return to Sieglinde (A) once more for your reward.

nodes.title: Talk with Yoran-Oran at G-10, near the Goal-tracking Galka (Base Camp).
nodes.description: Talk with Yoran-Oran at G-10, near the Goal-tracking Galka (Base Camp).

nodes.title: He will mention that people have been having trouble breathing since arriving in Attohwa, and ask yo
nodes.description: He will mention that people have been having trouble breathing since arriving in Attohwa, and ask you to seek out the source of the sickness.

nodes.title: The source is the poison flowers all around the western section of the zone.
nodes.description: The source is the poison flowers all around the western section of the zone. You must find one flower that gives you a Gasponia stamen.

nodes.title: Gasponia Flowers can be found in E-6 and F-7 along the walls and in other locations (East of Conflux
nodes.description: Gasponia Flowers can be found in E-6 and F-7 along the walls and in other locations (East of Conflux 2 has the highest concentration nearby with little to no aggro.) F-8 has a massive concentration of them, just a little north from Conflux 0. The correct flower is random; it's different for each player.

nodes.title: Return with the Gasponia stamen to receive a Scroll of Cura II.
nodes.description: Return with the Gasponia stamen to receive a Scroll of Cura II.

nodes.title: After clearing Cleansing the Canyon, reenter Abyssea - Tahrongi and talk to Kupipi (A) to start the
nodes.description: After clearing Cleansing the Canyon, reenter Abyssea - Tahrongi and talk to Kupipi (A) to start the quest.

nodes.title: She asks you to defeat either Cuelebre, Adze, Minhocao, Chukwa or Mictlantecuhtli.
nodes.description: She asks you to defeat either Cuelebre, Adze, Minhocao, Chukwa or Mictlantecuhtli.

nodes.title: After accepting the quest, kill any one of these NMs to obtain a Bloodied arrow.
nodes.description: After accepting the quest, kill any one of these NMs to obtain a Bloodied arrow. When repeating the quest, you receive a Crimson bloodstone instead that can be turned in for 500 cruor.

nodes.title: Return to Kupipi (A) for your reward.
nodes.description: Return to Kupipi (A) for your reward.

nodes.title: This quest is flagged automatically upon completing Heart of Madness.
nodes.description: This quest is flagged automatically upon completing Heart of Madness.

nodes.title: Joachim will ask you to travel, once again, to the stone circle in La Theine Plateau between dusk an
nodes.description: Joachim will ask you to travel, once again, to the stone circle in La Theine Plateau between dusk and dawn (18:00-5:00) to meet Gilgamesh. Click on the ??? at (G-6) in La Theine Plateau between 18:00 and 5:00 for a cutscene.

nodes.title: Return to Joachim and speak with him to complete this quest and automatically flag the next.
nodes.description: Return to Joachim and speak with him to complete this quest and automatically flag the next.

nodes.title: Exoroche asks for rusty shields, zaghnals, spears, or kunai.
nodes.description: Exoroche asks for rusty shields, zaghnals, spears, or kunai. They can be fished up in Abyssea - La Theine or purchased from the Auction House. One item is needed to complete the quest.

nodes.title: Rusty Kunai can be obtained in any of the 4 ponds in Abyssea - La Theine.
nodes.description: Rusty Kunai can be obtained in any of the 4 ponds in Abyssea - La Theine.

nodes.title: Rusty Spears can be obtained in the large pond south of the northern encampment and give three excla
nodes.description: Rusty Spears can be obtained in the large pond south of the northern encampment and give three exclamation marks (!!!).

nodes.title: Rusty Zaghnals can be obtained in the southeastern most pond nearest to the southeast encampment.
nodes.description: Rusty Zaghnals can be obtained in the southeastern most pond nearest to the southeast encampment.

nodes.title: Rusty Shields are obtained from killing Crabs which are frequently fished up in the pools in Abyssea
nodes.description: Rusty Shields are obtained from killing Crabs which are frequently fished up in the pools in Abyssea - La Theine. The crabs are Decent Challenge to level 78, but take care as the Notorious Monster Nahn can also be caught at these pools.

nodes.title: If you get a message with three exclamation marks (!!!) such as "Something caught the hook!!!", you
nodes.description: If you get a message with three exclamation marks (!!!) such as "Something caught the hook!!!", you might have fished up a monster and should consider cancelling it. If you are not skilled at distinguishing a monster from an item when fishing, or don't have a job that can solo crabs, you should cancel.

nodes.title: You should also fish on the the south side of the conflux #04 lake to avoid chat log spam from peopl
nodes.description: You should also fish on the the south side of the conflux #04 lake to avoid chat log spam from people trying to fish up the NM, which scrolls away the !!! message.

nodes.title: Bait or Lures for salt-water fishing, such as a Shrimp Lure, yield the best results for rusty items.
nodes.description: Bait or Lures for salt-water fishing, such as a Shrimp Lure, yield the best results for rusty items. Rusty Spears and Rusty Zaghnals can break your line if you're not careful, but catching monsters will use up bait.

nodes.title: This is an excellent quest for capping out fame in this zone since it can be quickly repeated multip
nodes.description: This is an excellent quest for capping out fame in this zone since it can be quickly repeated multiple times without needing to leave the zone. Halcyon Rod & Crayfish Ball around western small lake by Farfadets VC04 can yield Rusty Kunai.

nodes.title: Examine the Cavernous Maw in Jugner Forest at (J-8) after flagging Dawn of Death.
nodes.description: Examine the Cavernous Maw in Jugner Forest at (J-8) after flagging Dawn of Death. You must have a Traverser Stone in your inventory to start the quest, or you will simply be allowed to enter with no cutscene. If you defeat Ruszor without having the quest flagged, and then flag the quest later, you will automatically complete the quest after re-zoning.

nodes.title: You must Defeat the Ruszor NM Sedna.
nodes.description: You must Defeat the Ruszor NM Sedna.

nodes.title: Have one alliance member examine the ??? at (K-6) while possesing the key items: Glossy Sea Monk Suc
nodes.description: Have one alliance member examine the ??? at (K-6) while possesing the key items: Glossy Sea Monk Sucker and Shimmering Pugil Scale.

nodes.title: Upon defeating this menace, zone out of Abyssea - Vunkerl for the ending scene and your reward.
nodes.description: Upon defeating this menace, zone out of Abyssea - Vunkerl for the ending scene and your reward.

nodes.title: Talk to Deraquien, he will ask you to deliver supplies to the Outpost (Conflux #00) (I-9).
nodes.description: Talk to Deraquien, he will ask you to deliver supplies to the Outpost (Conflux #00) (I-9). You can choose from three weights of backpacks: Pocket supply pack: Gives approximately -24% movement speed. Reward: 300 cruor and 10 Resistance Credits. Repeating the quest gives 225 cruor and 10 Resistance Credits. Standard supply pack: Gives approximately -48% movement speed. Reward: 700 cruor and 35 Resistance Credits. Repeating the quest gives 525 cruor and 35 Resistance Credits. Hefty supply pack: Gives approximately -72% movement speed. Reward: 1500 cruor and 70 Resistance Credits. Repeating the quest gives 1125 cruor and 70 Resistance Credits.

nodes.title: Head to Elmemague (A) (I-9) at the outpost to receive a Letter of receipt.
nodes.description: Head to Elmemague (A) (I-9) at the outpost to receive a Letter of receipt. Being KO'd and Reraising clears the movement speed reduction but does not affect the quest negatively. You cannot use Veridical Confluxes to get there. Upon speaking to Elmemague, you receive the Flee status unless you died while carrying the pack.

nodes.title: Go back to Deraquien (A) to receive your reward.
nodes.description: Go back to Deraquien (A) to receive your reward. You can use Veridical Conluxes now. Rarely, this quest also grants a random Empyrean feet armor seal for the jobs above.

nodes.title: You do not have to zone out to repeat the quest.
nodes.description: You do not have to zone out to repeat the quest.

nodes.title: If you disconnect or change areas after delivering the goods, you still lose the completion key item
nodes.description: If you disconnect or change areas after delivering the goods, you still lose the completion key item. Deliver it to Deraquien (A) ASAP.

nodes.title: Warp to Conflux #08 and head northeast through the Stygian Djinn and possibly the Assailer Chariot (
nodes.description: Warp to Conflux #08 and head northeast through the Stygian Djinn and possibly the Assailer Chariot (true sound).

nodes.title: Talk to Ranpi-Monpi at (L-6) near the east wall to start the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Ranpi-Monpi at (L-6) near the east wall to start the quest.

nodes.title: Once the quest is flagged, examine an Earthy Mound to receive the Wivre egg.
nodes.description: Once the quest is flagged, examine an Earthy Mound to receive the Wivre egg. Confluxes can be used to move around until you examine an Earthy Mound and acquire the Wivre egg. One can be found near the border of (H-8) and (I-8). This egg is worth 200 cruor (400 on first completion) and may award a seal. Another is found at (J-10), next to Conflux #03. This egg is worth 200 (400 on first completion) cruor and may award a seal. A third is found at (J-6). This egg is worth 100 cruor (200 on first completion) and will not award a seal.

nodes.title: After collecting the Wivre egg, return to Ranpi-Monpi (L-6) without damaging the egg.
nodes.description: After collecting the Wivre egg, return to Ranpi-Monpi (L-6) without damaging the egg. Being attacked by any monster will break the egg. Using a conflux will break the egg. You will not receive a message or lose the key item when it is damaged. It is possible that your first warning will be when you fail the quest. Conditions that might also cause the egg to break: Being aggroed by a monster without being hit Talking to NPCs en-route (such as Eight of Clubs, or using a Martello) Taking too long Random egg break

nodes.title: After flagging one of the Vision of Abyssea main quests (A Goldstruck Gigas, To Paste a Peiste, and
nodes.description: After flagging one of the Vision of Abyssea main quests (A Goldstruck Gigas, To Paste a Peiste, and Megadrile Menace) talk to Joachim in Port Jeuno (H-8) to begin this quest.

nodes.title: This quest is semi-independent of the Abyssea quest progression.
nodes.description: This quest is semi-independent of the Abyssea quest progression. This quest signifies that you own Vision of Abyssea and have begun its boss quests. This quest will be marked as complete after you complete A Goldstruck Gigas, To Paste a Peiste, and Megadrile Menace.

nodes.title: After completing all three of the above quests, talk to Joachim again for a closing cutscene.
nodes.description: After completing all three of the above quests, talk to Joachim again for a closing cutscene.

nodes.title: Talk to the Eight of Hearts (A) at (H-13) middle of Square.
nodes.description: Talk to the Eight of Hearts (A) at (H-13) middle of Square. (Conflux #2)

nodes.title: Talk to the Eight of Clubs (A) at (H-8) to obtain a Silver Pocket Watch.
nodes.description: Talk to the Eight of Clubs (A) at (H-8) to obtain a Silver Pocket Watch. From (Conflux #5) head southeast with no risk of aggro.

nodes.title: Talk to Eight of Hearts (A) to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Eight of Hearts (A) to complete the quest.

nodes.title: Speak to Kororo (A) at (H-13) to flag the quest.
nodes.description: Speak to Kororo (A) at (H-13) to flag the quest. (Conflux #2) You do not need to zone after completing Master Missing, Master Missed to start this quest.

nodes.title: Speak to Eight of Clubs (A) at H-8.
nodes.description: Speak to Eight of Clubs (A) at H-8. From (Conflux #5) head southeast with no risk of agro.

nodes.title: Return to Kororo for your reward.
nodes.description: Return to Kororo for your reward.

nodes.title: Talk to Nogelle (A), who says she lost all of her Lufet salt and needs a substitute.
nodes.description: Talk to Nogelle (A), who says she lost all of her Lufet salt and needs a substitute.

nodes.title: Fish and kill Badlands Crabs until you obtain a Badlands Salt.
nodes.description: Fish and kill Badlands Crabs until you obtain a Badlands Salt. A good place to do this is the ponds near Veridical Conflux #06 . Keep sneak applied at all times to avoid aggro from the Fear Dearga. Alternately, you can catch them at the pond at (G-7), where there is nothing nearby to aggro.

nodes.title: Take the Badlands Salt to Nogelle (A) for your reward.
nodes.description: Take the Badlands Salt to Nogelle (A) for your reward.

nodes.title: Next to Cleades (A) at (G-5) (KS-06 Martello) (Take Veridical Conflux # 6 and head southeast to the
nodes.description: Next to Cleades (A) at (G-5) (KS-06 Martello) (Take Veridical Conflux # 6 and head southeast to the large rocks) are some boxes which you can obtain your Soulgauger SGR-1 and purchase Blank Gauger Plates for 5 cruor each (Max of 12 at a time).

nodes.title: Just as you would do for normal Soul Plate photos, find an NM and get a good, closeup frontal shot a
nodes.description: Just as you would do for normal Soul Plate photos, find an NM and get a good, closeup frontal shot and turn it back in to Cleades (A). Taking a picture upfront and close up to the NM will not qualify. A good distance and frontal shot, around 4-5 yalms, will get you a perfect shot. You need not have the enemy claimed or lower its HP in order to take a worthwhile picture; distance and angle appear to be the only important factors.

nodes.title: Note: Only Notorious Monsters in Abyssea - Konschtat can be photographed with the Soulgauger SGR-1.
nodes.description: Note: Only Notorious Monsters in Abyssea - Konschtat can be photographed with the Soulgauger SGR-1. It cannot be used in other Abyssea areas. However, pictures of VNMs spawned using the Clear Demuline Abyssite will count for the purpose of this quest. Guimauve and Pavan are good Soul Plate subjects- not only do they spawn nearby, but they also do not aggro.

nodes.title: Bring Titus (A) a clump of Windurstian tea leaves.
nodes.description: Bring Titus (A) a clump of Windurstian tea leaves. Closest transport is Veridical Conflux 5.

nodes.title: He gives you a military ink package to take to Chumimi (A) at the Oasis next to Revelation Rock at (
nodes.description: He gives you a military ink package to take to Chumimi (A) at the Oasis next to Revelation Rock at (G-7), east of Veridical Conflux 7.

nodes.title: Talk to Joachim in Port Jeuno at (H-8) to receive a Traverser Stone.
nodes.description: Talk to Joachim in Port Jeuno at (H-8) to receive a Traverser Stone.

nodes.title: Talk to Oiheaurese at the Chumimi's Camp (closest to Conflux #7) to begin the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Oiheaurese at the Chumimi's Camp (closest to Conflux #7) to begin the quest. He asks for a Wyvern egg.

nodes.title: Talk to Yachemidot at (J-9) and he will give you a Wyvern egg.
nodes.description: Talk to Yachemidot at (J-9) and he will give you a Wyvern egg.

nodes.title: Take the Wyvern egg to (K-8) in Meriphataud Mountains, along the eastern edge of Drogaroga's Spine.
nodes.description: Take the Wyvern egg to (K-8) in Meriphataud Mountains, along the eastern edge of Drogaroga's Spine.

nodes.title: Talk to Rashid located at (Camp Courage) (F-9) (NW of Conflux #02) to start the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Rashid located at (Camp Courage) (F-9) (NW of Conflux #02) to start the quest. Technically, Full-of-Himself Alchemist does not need to be completed to start this quest, but Rose on the Heath does. The quest dynamics seem to be a bit messed up at this point. Full-of-Himself Alchemist will not count as completed if you trade Julio the Purple Polypores while Rose on the Heath isn't completed yet. However if you complete Rose on the Heath afterward, you will be able to start this quest already, even though Full-of-Himself Alchemist will still be listed under current quests.

nodes.title: Use the Soothing Potions acquired from the quest Full-of-Himself Alchemist and trade them to the Res
nodes.description: Use the Soothing Potions acquired from the quest Full-of-Himself Alchemist and trade them to the Resistance Fighters fighting around Captain Rashid's encampment. The Full-of-Himself Alchemist quest only rewards you with two Soothing Potions so you will need to complete the quest at least three times to obtain enough to heal all five of the soldiers.

nodes.title: Talk to Rashid to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Rashid to complete the quest.

nodes.title: In Abyssea - Empyreal Paradox, you receive Visitant Status automatically, and it does not wear off.
nodes.description: In Abyssea - Empyreal Paradox, you receive Visitant Status automatically, and it does not wear off.

nodes.title: Examine the Trascendental Radiance within Abyssea - Empyreal Paradox for a cutscene.
nodes.description: Examine the Trascendental Radiance within Abyssea - Empyreal Paradox for a cutscene. You may exit the zone at any point prior to entering the battlefield without losing your Crimson Traverser Stone.

nodes.title: You can receive Atma, Temporary Items and Cruor Enhancements from the Cruor Prospector and Atma Infu
nodes.description: You can receive Atma, Temporary Items and Cruor Enhancements from the Cruor Prospector and Atma Infusionist NPCs in the area before entering.

nodes.title: Examining the Radiance again will prompt you to enter the battlefield "The Wyrm God".
nodes.description: Examining the Radiance again will prompt you to enter the battlefield "The Wyrm God". Entering the battlefield consumes your Crimson traverser stone.

nodes.title: Defeat Shinryu.
nodes.description: Defeat Shinryu. This is a 6-person BCNM battlefield. All party members must possess a Crimson traverser stone, obtained with 10,000 Cruor and one Traverser stone upon entry to Abyssea - Empyreal Paradox, to enter the battlefield. Buffs and TP are not lost when entering the battlefield. Shinryu is susceptible to all weakness trigger conditions, like any other Abyssean Notorious Monster. The time limit to kill Shinryu is 30 minutes.

nodes.title: After defeating Shinryu, talk to Prishe for a cutscene.
nodes.description: After defeating Shinryu, talk to Prishe for a cutscene. The cutscene starts the next quest.

nodes.title: If you KO, you will lose Experience Points.
nodes.description: If you KO, you will lose Experience Points.

nodes.title: To get to the Field Encampment at Veridical Conflux #8, first talk to Red Ghost who will teleport yo
nodes.description: To get to the Field Encampment at Veridical Conflux #8, first talk to Red Ghost who will teleport you above the ledge to Alrauverat.

nodes.title: Talk to Ponono who is next to the Veridical Conflux #8.
nodes.description: Talk to Ponono who is next to the Veridical Conflux #8.

nodes.title: Obtain 3 Amoeban Pseudopods which can be bought on AH or farm them from Protoamoebans and Ephemeral
nodes.description: Obtain 3 Amoeban Pseudopods which can be bought on AH or farm them from Protoamoebans and Ephemeral Amoeban in Abyssea - Misareaux, or Crevice Amoeban in Abyssea - Attohwa southeast and southwest of Veridical Conflux #00.

nodes.title: Using Steal or Despoil works.
nodes.description: Using Steal or Despoil works.

nodes.title: Trade the 3 Amoeban Pseudopods to Ponono to receive your reward.
nodes.description: Trade the 3 Amoeban Pseudopods to Ponono to receive your reward.

nodes.title: The quest will automatically flag upon checking the Cavernous Maw in Konschtat Highlands with a Trav
nodes.description: The quest will automatically flag upon checking the Cavernous Maw in Konschtat Highlands with a Traverser Stone in your inventory and Dawn of Death in your current quests. If you defeat Kukulkan without having the quest flagged, and then flag the quest later, you will automatically complete the quest after re-zoning.

nodes.title: Proceed to H-5, and click the ??? at the bottom of the crater to pop Kukulkan.
nodes.description: Proceed to H-5, and click the ??? at the bottom of the crater to pop Kukulkan. Three key items are needed to pop it, but only one person needs to have them: Tattered hippogryph wing from Alkonost. Cracked wivre horn from Keratyrannos Mucid Ahriman eyeball from Arimaspi

nodes.title: Kill Kukulkan.
nodes.description: Kill Kukulkan. It is a difficult battle, so a full alliance is recommended. All members of the alliance will receive credit for the kill. The title is received at this point. Exit Abyssea - Konschtat by using the Cavernous Maw, timing out or Teleport gateway to Abyssea - Konschtat for a cut scene.

nodes.title: Talk to Joulet (Conflux #4).
nodes.description: Talk to Joulet (Conflux #4). He gives you a Broken Willow Rod and asks you to fix it.

nodes.title: Trade a Willow Fishing Rod to his brother Gallijaux at the (L-11) Encampment (Conflux #6).
nodes.description: Trade a Willow Fishing Rod to his brother Gallijaux at the (L-11) Encampment (Conflux #6). You do not need to fix the rod that Joulet gives to you; you can use any Willow Fishing Rod to finish this quest.

nodes.title: Speak to Yurim (A) (Base Camp) to start the quest.
nodes.description: Speak to Yurim (A) (Base Camp) to start the quest.

nodes.title: Optional: You can give her an Apple Pie to make her tell you the name of what she wants.
nodes.description: Optional: You can give her an Apple Pie to make her tell you the name of what she wants. This is optional. You only need to trade a Murex Spicule to complete the quest.

nodes.title: Trade her a Murex Spicule to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Trade her a Murex Spicule to complete the quest.

nodes.title: Speak with Rukususu at the Second Encampment (F-10) (South of Veridical Conflux 7, near the bottom o
nodes.description: Speak with Rukususu at the Second Encampment (F-10) (South of Veridical Conflux 7, near the bottom of the waterfall).

nodes.title: Go to (D-8) and fight Sensenmann until you receive a Decaying Molar.
nodes.description: Go to (D-8) and fight Sensenmann until you receive a Decaying Molar.

nodes.title: Look for a ??? in (D-8).
nodes.description: Look for a ??? in (D-8).

nodes.title: Trade the Decaying Molar to the ??? to spawn Xibalba.
nodes.description: Trade the Decaying Molar to the ??? to spawn Xibalba.

nodes.title: Defeating Xibalba will drop an Ominous Skull and the Indigo Abyssite of Merit.
nodes.description: Defeating Xibalba will drop an Ominous Skull and the Indigo Abyssite of Merit.

nodes.title: Go to the the westernmost ??? in (C-8) for the short message.
nodes.description: Go to the the westernmost ??? in (C-8) for the short message. The message is "A spectral voice echoes within your mind... Death becomes...he who trespasses...these grounds...". This is required before Rukususu will accept the Ominous Skull.

nodes.title: Trade the Ominous Skull to Rukususu (A) to complete the quest and receive theIndigo Abyssite of Leni
nodes.description: Trade the Ominous Skull to Rukususu (A) to complete the quest and receive theIndigo Abyssite of Lenity .

nodes.title: Talk to Yasuji (A) at Conflux #3.
nodes.description: Talk to Yasuji (A) at Conflux #3.

nodes.title: Open a blue Sturdy Pyxis to get the key item Medical Supply Chest.
nodes.description: Open a blue Sturdy Pyxis to get the key item Medical Supply Chest. The item will not show up in the chest when peering in. If you open the chest using a Forbidden Key you won't get the key item. You need to open chest via guessing game. When obtaining the key item from the chest, you will still receive the regular reward that the chest contains. A chest obtained with capped Azure (Magic kills) lights seems to have more chance to drop the key item, but it is possible to get it out of a 1-guess chest.

nodes.title: Return to Yasuji (A) for your reward.
nodes.description: Return to Yasuji (A) for your reward.

nodes.description: Talk to the Resistance Sapper to obtain a Magicked hempen sack. Hint: Use Conflux #00 to get to the Resistance Sapper quickly.

nodes.description: Talk to the Resistance Sapper and accept the quest. He will mark your target area on the map. This is a different crate than the one used in Desert Rain II (Attohwa).

nodes.description: Your objective: Escort the chocobo to the repair crate, load up one or more materials, and escort the chocobo back to the Chocobo Tamer.

nodes.title: Speak to Miageau (A) and accept his request to purify the waters of Abyssea.
nodes.description: Speak to Miageau (A) and accept his request to purify the waters of Abyssea.

nodes.title: He will give you four purification chemicals (key items), each with a different color.
nodes.description: He will give you four purification chemicals (key items), each with a different color.

nodes.title: Travel to the four ponds of Abyssea, and examine the Murky Water to purify it.
nodes.description: Travel to the four ponds of Abyssea, and examine the Murky Water to purify it. Pond one (L-10) is located just outside the Southern Encampment (Conflux 06), surrounded by Crapaudies (nonaggressive). Pond two (K-11) is slightly southwest of the Southern Encampment, surrounded by aggressive Poroggo Seducteurs. They are true sound, but you have to get pretty close to them to aggro. The final two ponds are located close to the Central Encampment (Conflux 04); the large lake (H-7) and smaller pond (H-7) are surrounded by Plateau Gliders and Farfadets respectively.

nodes.title: Return to Miageau (A) for your reward.
nodes.description: Return to Miageau (A) for your reward. Evolith rewards include some unique augments such as "Martello use -2".

nodes.title: Talk with Chapi Galepilai at Base camp (G-10).
nodes.description: Talk with Chapi Galepilai at Base camp (G-10).

nodes.title: She'll ask you to find the three missing supplies: Clone ward reinforcement pack (F-9) Pack of outpo
nodes.description: She'll ask you to find the three missing supplies: Clone ward reinforcement pack (F-9) Pack of outpost repair tools (F-9) Pulse martello repair pack (G-8)

nodes.title: All three Supply Packs are located in the area near the Crevice Amoeban and Treacle Slug.
nodes.description: All three Supply Packs are located in the area near the Crevice Amoeban and Treacle Slug.

nodes.title: Once you have found at least one of the packs, go find Morlepiche who is located at the Veridical Co
nodes.description: Once you have found at least one of the packs, go find Morlepiche who is located at the Veridical Conflux #00.

nodes.title: After talking to Morlepiche, he will reward you with Cruor and Credits.
nodes.description: After talking to Morlepiche, he will reward you with Cruor and Credits.

nodes.title: Head to the Western Encampment at (F-9) (Conflux #3) and speak with Peshi Yohnts, who asks you to ex
nodes.description: Head to the Western Encampment at (F-9) (Conflux #3) and speak with Peshi Yohnts, who asks you to excavate a Hardened Bone and gives you a Pickaxe; destination (E-5). She only gives you a free Pickaxe the first time you do the quest; not the subsequent times. Heading northwest and following the west wall, you will pass some Nauls and then Caoineag. OR head northeast around the mountain and then north, past the Canyon Scorpions and the mountain, then west past the Thalassinons at (F-5). OR you can warp from Veridical Conflux #3 to #6, and head west.

nodes.title: You will see a dragon skeleton and a number of Excavation Points around the area.
nodes.description: You will see a dragon skeleton and a number of Excavation Points around the area. Like Mining points, they may only last one or two attempts to dig up the item. The points move around this area, and there can be three excavation points up at any one time. You need to keep excavating using your Pickaxes until you get the Hardened Bone. NOTE: You may not receive the Hardened Bone the first time, so it is recommended to bring more pickaxes. You may break many pickaxes and obtain several items unrelated to the quest, so be sure you have inventory space or be willing to discard items.

nodes.title: Return to Peshi Yohnts and trade the Hardened Bone to her to complete the quest and receive 100 cruo
nodes.description: Return to Peshi Yohnts and trade the Hardened Bone to her to complete the quest and receive 100 cruor.

nodes.title: Talk to Apururu to start the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Apururu to start the quest. Note: Apururu also mentions that once you start, you must stay in the zone until you finish. Should you leave, you must restart your investigation.

nodes.title: You must speak to 5 Cardians to determine which ones are malfunctioning: one at each exit of the mai
nodes.description: You must speak to 5 Cardians to determine which ones are malfunctioning: one at each exit of the main camp (one west and one east) and one at each of the other camps. (F-9: Veridical Conflux 3, H-4: Veridical Conflux 5, I-7: Veridical Conflux 7)

nodes.title: Talk to each Cardian and review its response.
nodes.description: Talk to each Cardian and review its response. Check the responses of the Cardians.

nodes.title: Talk to Rahal (A) to begin the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Rahal (A) to begin the quest. Completing the quest A Ward to End All Wards 15-20 trades should get you the fame necessary to begin this quest.

nodes.title: Obtain a Black Whisker.
nodes.description: Obtain a Black Whisker. Black Whiskers can be obtained either by killing Slaughterous Smilodons or can be purchased from the auction house.

nodes.title: Trade the Black Whisker to Rahal (A) for your reward.
nodes.description: Trade the Black Whisker to Rahal (A) for your reward. (Veridical Conflux #1 (F-4)) You get the Black Whisker back after finishing the quest.
